item.description:
Would you like to plan and lead your own trips with us?

If so, then the AMC Boston Chapter's Leadership Training is a great place to start. I took this class several years ago and I often refer back to the information and materials that were part of the program. So far at least ten of our organizers have completed this course and are leaders with both the Random Group and the AMC.

While you can use this event listing to get together with other randomites who are going and to coordinate car pooling, you need to officially regsiter for this program on the AMC Boston Chapter's website by clicking here.

This is a great way to get an learn more about putting together and leading your own trips - whether it's with the Random Group, the AMC, or just a bunch of your friends. The program emphasizes group dynamics, leader responsibilities, trip planning/management, decision-making skills, and how to handle incidents and emergencies. You will learn great skills in this supportive and fun environment by engaging in role playing, decision games, and group planning exercises.

The course consists of two evening classes (Thursday Night April 5 and Thursday Night April 12) at AMC Headquarters in Boston and one weekend event (Friday Night April 20 - Sunday Afternoon April 22) at a New England location to be determined. The registration fee covers training, materials, weekend lodging and meals (except lunches). Space is limited to 24 participants.

There are two kinds of people in this world: Leaders and followers. This is your opportunity to become a Leader.

Questions:

I will be helping teach this program. If you have any questions you can send me a note or email the program coordinator Stephen Colin at springleadership@hbbostonamc.org.
